comment: If i was writing this just on him as a teachr - 100, everything is grossly easy but the tests, here is the thing, the tests r CRAZY hard but he grades them generously. Got like 8 ques wrong and got a 100. Hilarious, explains well, interactive, easy 100 assignments. Only problem - the LEAST organized teacher you will ever see - talk to classmates!!!
Super fun and awesome guy! He uses a lot of personal anecdotes which is cool. His only bad quality is that his power points can be a little confusing but other than that he is super cool.

Honestly one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. I missed about three weeks of class due to getting sick back to back and I was still able to pass with a decent grade. The test are easy if you show up to class because he writes test questions and answers on the board throughout class. Only downside is that he is hard to contact.

GG was great! go to class because attendance is mandatory. his lectures are entertaining. you're graded by a few things but it's easy. he provides you with the questions and answers to each test so go to class! there's one group assignment apart of the course. the only con is that he's hard to reach through email and not that organized.

GG is a great professor, passionate about anthropology and clearly cares for his students. He makes a great effort to make the teacher-student relationship feel very natural throughout the semester. Be warned however, GG will (for the most part) not answer emails.

GG was a great Professor. You could tell he really loves anthropology and isn't there just for a paycheck. His test were completely fill-in-the-blank, but he gives the questions before the test, so you'd just have to remember them.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: GG's lectures were always engaging and fun! The tests themselves were relatively easy (he gave the questions in class, then you had to find the answers and study them) and he made it a point to emphasize that he understood his class wasn't the only thing going on in his students' lives.

Easiest class I took this semester. He gives you the test questions before the test, literally just show up to class and you will get an A. The only thing that stumped me was the final because I got confused on the wording of the questions but every test and assignment before that was extremely easy.

Very friendly. Not a bad professor if you're sure you can love the subject. The whole semester felt very disorganized and he doesn't communicate well outside of class. The tests were open-ended. Graded on attendance but the lectures dragged on for too long with a lot of unnecessary information so being there felt unnecessary other than for a grade.

I can't say enough amazing things about Professor Gitahi. He is easily the best professor I have ever had. Him teaching this class has shown me that I want to be an anthropology major and this is my calling. I recommend that you take a class of his, anthropology or not, just for the amazing experience that his lectures give every single week.

George is one of the nicest and funniest professors Ive ever met. You can tell he is truly passionate about what he teaches and cares for his students. Thank you for giving me a better college experience, GG!

Without a doubt George (GG) has been my favorite professor. His lectures are very interesting and I found my self wanting to go to class! Easy A if you show up and listen! He understands that everyone has some other things going on in life and is very lenient. Will say he is still learning how to move to a hybrid/ online class.

I love him. He is so funny and I don't think I have ever not enjoyed being in his class. Only a few times have his lectures been boring but he is such a pure person. His tests are all fill in the blank but he gives you the test questions. You just have to find the answers yourself. When I missed class for a week he asked me if I was okay. Take him!

He is disoragnized and does not teach you. He always goes off topic. Most of what you learn is on your own time outside of class. He hasn't posted the grades for the whole semester. It's been three weeks since the final and no one has received their grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I heard amazing things about him but this semester he slipped, I guess. He didnt give us his policies on the syllabus until half way through the semester and didnt post grades (for the whole semester) until the day grades were due. Besides that, he is an amazing person and the class is very easy to learn!

He was an extremely sweet teacher. His way of teaching as most people have already said if lecturing and giving you 2-5 test bank questions that are guaranteed to be on his tests. There are three tests and they all have fill in the blank/matching, short answer and multiple choice questions. If you go to class, you should get an A.

I thought this class would be an easy A, but he makes the class more difficult than it should be. He gives test questions every class for the test, but there's always content on there that wasn't mentioned in class. Two quizzes over videos watched in class. I wouldn't take him again because the class is unorganized and he never replies to emails

Not an easy class. He is disorganized and tells you to study test bank, which do not help you for the actuall test. Must have textbook to survive. Lectures are pointless but attendance is a grade. Always talks about Africa and nothing relavent to class. Overall, horrible teacher. 3 test and 2 quizzes. Don't take him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: GG is a very sweet and considerate person. He does have a an accent but it is not difficult to understand. He also teaches so that you actually learn lessons and is very enganging at times. He does test banks which helps to prepare for his actual tests which are super easy. Very amazing man and I would definitely take him again!

This class is straightforward. Show up, get test answers, take exams and quizzes, pass the class with an A. Attendance is a grade. 2 quizzes are on videos you watch in class, and he gives you answers to exams every day. Like 2-3 questions for the exams come daily on the board; more incentive to show up. He's an INCREDIBLE person.. easy A.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: GG is the best. He makes class very easy by using a test bank which is word for word your test. I did not go to class because it was so easy, but he does take attendance as a grade. He's a great guy and is so caring and understanding. Makes the class an easy A!

THE SWEETEST MAN. first of all, he gives you the test questions in a "Test bank" everyday before class, and his lecture has all the answers. so hes really easy. BUT he is SO caring. this girl didnt eat lunch one day in class and he gave her money to go get starbucks. hes a preacher, also. SO SWEET. TAKE HIM. i loved going to class.

GG is awesome! Super hilarious Kenyan man, very religious and it shows, but hey, he's a pastor, that's his job. He's great at his job and makes it so easy on students by giving "Test Banks" which are really the exact answers to the tests. Just study those and any handouts given and there's no way you won't get an A.

I know a lot of people say this but it was the easiest class I have ever taken, not only in KSU, but my whole life. GG gives you a couple questions for your test bank every day and you memorize them. Tests take less than 5 minutes if you looked at the test bank. 5 take home quizzes, 3 tests. He mentions he wants everyone to get A's the first day.

GG  was really funny, he's originally from Kenya so you also end up teaching him a lot . The class is easy just keep up with what you need to do. There are " word banks" (quizzes) but he gives you the answers to them ahead of time, only possibly requires a little studying if any. And there is a group presentation but it isn't hard. I would take him

Very Sweet man! He was a breath fresh air because he doesn't stuff his ideas down your throat like every other professor I've had. Just show up, and only because it's a good class not because it's really required. I did all the quizzes five minutes before class. Study for the tests but they're easy.

Gitahi aka GG is amazing. Class consists of four exams, two quizzes, and final. The quizzes are easy because they are over documentary watched in class and test consists of the test bank questions and matching of vocab terms. The test bank questions are given each day, so go to class. But memorize the answer: the test is fill in blank. Got an A!

GG is an incredibly intelligent, funny, and amazing professor. He is Kenyan and has an accent BUT you can still understand him. Supper helpful and makes the context understandable and super interesting. He is hilarious. Gives 3 test bank question at the beginning of class and answers at the end. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

GG is the bomb. He is Kenyan so sometimes it is hard to understand him, but everything he wants you to know is literally written on the board before each class. Attendance is taken every day but class is enjoyable and fun. Great guy and full of funny stories.

Professor GG is the most laidback professor I have ever had at KSU. His class is easy as long as you copy the test bank terms. The field study is fairly easy as long as you know someone foreign. If you don't, try use some filler. You don't need the test book. GG is also very easy to work with about grades as long as you show up to class. Recommend.

One of my favorite teachers. Highly encourages group discussions and debates on topics. Average class was "Discuss previous topic, short powerpoint over new topic, class discussion, video related to topic". Also posted 'Test Bank' questions each day that would be the exact question on the upcoming test. Highly recommend taking this prof.

This class was easy I got a B but George is easily distracted and runs off topic from time to time.4 test 1 two pg paper 1 project and attendance grade. Go to class get test bank questions do all assignments and you will easily pass

He has a strong accent which can be difficult to understand. He can get distracted very easily making it harder to pay attention. Each class he makes a test bank which is exactly what the questions on the test will be but the tests are short answer. He is an overall great teacher but not very tech savvy so its hard to get help from him.

Great guy. He is hilarious and entertaining. He gets the students involved in the discussions, that is pretty much all this class is. Made it very easy to come to class. Each day he writes "test bank" questions on board, basically those are things he is lecturing about that day and those are the test questions so write those down with the answers.

GG is hilarious! Writes test questions on the board and then spends class giving you the answers. You need the book for your presentation. There is a fieldstudy report where you interview 2 intl students. Attendance is at end of class. Wants students to pass. My class was doing poorly, so he made one exam takehome! 4 tests, final is NOT cumulative.

Professor GG is awesome. He gives you a test bank at the beginning of every class so that you know exactly what questions are on the test. He doesn't want anyone to fail. He is very straight forward with his lectures and pretty much goes by the test questions. Attend every class and keep up with the test bank. Doesn't really use the book much.
Easy class, book is necessary for your presentation but other then that you don't need it.  Go to class, take note of the Test Bank he uses, and you'll be fine.
Easy class. Hes an awesome teacher. We pretty much teach each other. Only a few tests, very easy if you go to class. Takes attendance. I would definitely recommend him.
Very awesome guy, Interesting and funny. He can go off on tangents yet I feel i gained from the class. A lot of the test was opinionated and were very easy. Least stressful class of all!

Great professor, I'd recommend! By the way, the textbook is VERY important in this course, contrary to what some people on here are saying. Most of his tests are "fill in the blank"-style questions, so you have to be familiar with the material. Just do this and you'll get a good grade.

He is a nice professor, however very unorganized and tends to get off on tangents.  He will give you test bank questions in each class make sure you get him to answer them otherwise you will wonder what he was teaching.  You do not need the textbook so don't waste money on it.  1 presentation and 4 tests.  Overall:  Easy but boring.

He is a such a sweet guy but he is a little unorganized. Lucky all of his test cover information that his has given out. Pay attention to test banks and the review, if you study properly you will make the grade you want. Yes he is a pastor, but he has an open mind and allows everyone to share their point of view. Great guy, fun class.

Anthropology 2105. This was my best class this semester. he gives u study questions before each test/ exam and 90% of it comes out. just attend his classes and you'll do great. he posts notes online so u dont need the textbook. attendance is important. try not to walk out of his class  during lecture. i recommend him 100%
He's a really nice man, and if you pay attention to what he's saying you can associate his crazy stories about Kenya with the different aspects of anthropology.
GG was awesome. speak up in his class. make your opinion heard. loved this class. tests are easy. great all around experience.

He lost my emailed paper six different times. I asked him every class period if he had greaded it and he said he never got it and I would show him proof from my school sent box. I was in his class every day yet he did not know my name. He also gave us a semi easy final and his review at the same time and left us all alone in the room hoping that we

He makes up the tests right before he gets to class and always admits he forgets about the test until earlier in the day. He'll say "study this" but that is usually misleading. Expects you to memorize 8 chapters worth of useless definitions for one test that he doesn't even teach. Brings up God in the class room as he's a pastor. Stay far away!

He's a nice guy and seems funny at first but the longer you stay in the class the more useless you realize it is. Tests are half vocab and half random questions. Doesn't speak English well & doesn't understand anything. Besides tests, gives papers back ridiculously late. Class has nothing to do with the tests but he takes attendance. Don't take him

He's a sweet man, so I feel kinda bad complaining about him, but his tests were incongruous with his classes. Basically, he provoked discussion, and the class argued, and then he tests you on things you never really learned. Read the chapters before the tests or you will absolutely fail them. He doesn't like to give bad grades if he can help it.

The tests are fairly easy if you study the defination handouts throughly.  We had one paper, which was 3 pgs, and extremely easy to write.  He gives everyone plenty of opportunities to get their desired grade, even the slackers. He loves everyone and his job. Would most def recommend you to take him.

I loved this class. I was not interested going into it, but he definitely made it fun to go to. He is hard to understand, but you are mostly doing class discussions and he wants you to get an A and is always willing to help you out to get the grade you want!!! I absolutely recommend him!

Found this class interesting. We had 3 essay tests and a paper. He really wants you to do well. He will give extra work if you need it. It is a class discussion themed course. He left a little too much to class discussion. He was very nice and I could understand his accent for the most part.

Gitahi is a great guy, and he means well. That aside, I learned NOTHING in this class. If you want an easy A in a class you rarely have to attend, then this is the class for you. I actually wanted to learn and was so disappointed. The know-it-alls in the class talked more than he did! The class was BORING. If you like Anth, avoid this class!

GG was a great teacher! His accent makes him hard to understand at times, but he was very helpful and fun. I didn't buy the book or read it at all and still made an A. I just paid attention to the notes and wrote detailed essays on the tests. A great class- I learned a lot and GG is a fantastic teacher!

Grades consist of four tests--they are very easy if you pay attention! His tests are disorganized and doesn't really give clear notes, so pay attention. He does, however, ask thought-provoking questions that inspire a lot of class debate. He knows his stuff and shares a lot of his experiences. A sweet man.
Professor G.G. rocks! Pretty funny guy. You have to read the book to be able to participate and to finish the worksheets for each topic.
